    • Method Detail

      • sha1

        static java.lang.String sha1​(java.lang.Object... vals)
        Returns the SHA-1 hash of the concatenation of VALS, which may be any mixture of byte arrays and Strings.

      • sha1

        static java.lang.String sha1​(java.util.List<java.lang.Object> vals)
        Returns the SHA-1 hash of the concatenation of the strings in VALS.

      • restrictedDelete

        static boolean restrictedDelete​(java.io.File file)
        Deletes FILE if it exists and is not a directory. Returns true if FILE was deleted, and false otherwise. Refuses to delete FILE and throws IllegalArgumentException unless the directory designated by FILE also contains a directory named .gitlet.

      • restrictedDelete

        static boolean restrictedDelete​(java.lang.String file)
        Deletes the file named FILE if it exists and is not a directory. Returns true if FILE was deleted, and false otherwise. Refuses to delete FILE and throws IllegalArgumentException unless the directory designated by FILE also contains a directory named .gitlet.

      • readContents

        static byte[] readContents​(java.io.File file)
        Return the entire contents of FILE as a byte array. FILE must be a normal file. Throws IllegalArgumentException in case of problems.

      • readContentsAsString

        static java.lang.String readContentsAsString​(java.io.File file)
        Return the entire contents of FILE as a String. FILE must be a normal file. Throws IllegalArgumentException in case of problems.

      • writeContents

        static void writeContents​(java.io.File file,
                          java.lang.Object... contents)
        Write the result of concatenating the bytes in CONTENTS to FILE, creating or overwriting it as needed. Each object in CONTENTS may be either a String or a byte array. Throws IllegalArgumentException in case of problems.

      • readObject

        static <T extends java.io.Serializable> T readObject​(java.io.File file,
                                                     java.lang.Class<T> expectedClass)
        Return an object of type T read from FILE, casting it to EXPECTEDCLASS. Throws IllegalArgumentException in case of problems.

      • writeObject

        static void writeObject​(java.io.File file,
                        java.io.Serializable obj)
        Write OBJ to FILE.

      • plainFilenamesIn

        static java.util.List<java.lang.String> plainFilenamesIn​(java.io.File dir)
        Returns a list of the names of all plain files in the directory DIR, in lexicographic order as Java Strings. Returns null if DIR does not denote a directory.

      • plainFilenamesIn

        static java.util.List<java.lang.String> plainFilenamesIn​(java.lang.String dir)
        Returns a list of the names of all plain files in the directory DIR, in lexicographic order as Java Strings. Returns null if DIR does not denote a directory.
